newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring bids drop.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring bids drop.

text.p: Dark northern spring wheat and soft white wheat bids dropped on Monday in sync with lower MGE wheat futures prices, dealers said.
But MGE September futures found some support from Monday's USDA March planting intentions report.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture early Monday said U.S. farmers would plant 17.775 million acres of spring wheat this year, below an average of analysts' estimates of 18.55 million.
Dealers reported scant farm sales but said spring wheat plantings seemed to be on track in Minnesota and North Dakota.
If the weather cooperates, spring wheat plantings should start in about two weeks, a Minnesota dealer said.
But in Montana, rain has hampered movement. It was quiet, one dealer said.
MGE May wheat lost 5-3/4 cents at $4.12-1/2 a bushel.
